parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

datasetStructure: One record per finding per observation time per subject or pool

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.POOLID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used for pooling subjects to assign a single finding to multiple subjects. If POOLID is entered, POOLDEF records must exist for each subject and the USUBJID must be null. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
datasetVariables.label: Pool Identifier
datasetVariables.name: POOLID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.FOCID

datasetVariables.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as defined in the protocol, for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. An example could be a drug application site, e.g. "Injection site 1," "Biopsy site 1," "Treated site 1." the value in this variable should have inherent semantic value.
datasetVariables.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
datasetVariables.name: FOCID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLSEQ

datasetVariables.description: The sequence number must be unique for each record within a USUBJID or POOLID, whichever applies for the record.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: CLSEQ

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject or pool. This is not the treatment group number.
datasetVariables.label: Group Identifier
datasetVariables.name: CLGRPID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLSPID

datasetVariables.description: Mass identifier such as MASS 1 or MASS A. Used when the mass was discovered during the in-life phase and assigned a mass identifier. The mass identification should be unique within the subject, regardless of mass location.
datasetVariables.label: Mass Identifier
datasetVariables.name: CLSPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CLTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CLTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). CLTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
datasetVariables.label: Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: CLTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLTEST

datasetVariables.description: Long name for CLTESTCD. The value in CLTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
datasetVariables.label: Test Name
datasetVariables.name: CLTEST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C89963

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of the clinical observation.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Clinical Observations
datasetVariables.name: CLCAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to further categorize a group of clinical observations within a category. For example "Whole Body Appearance" and "Sensory Organ Appearance" may be subcategories within Clinical Signs.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Clinical Observations
datasetVariables.name: CLSCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C88026

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLBODSYS

datasetVariables.description: Body system or organ class associated with the measurement performed.
datasetVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
datasetVariables.name: CLBODSYS

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLORRES

datasetVariables.description: Text description of the finding as originally received or collected. If the examination was not performed on a particular body system, or at the subject level, then the value should be null, and NOT DONE should appear in CLSTAT.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Findings as Collected
datasetVariables.name: CLORRES

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: The base finding from CLORRES without modifiers. If the examination was completed and there were no abnormal findings, the value must be NORMAL.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Character Format
datasetVariables.name: CLSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLRESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding post collection. Examples: Color or Facial.
datasetVariables.label: Result Category
datasetVariables.name: CLRESCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate examination not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in CLORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: CLSTAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why CLSTAT is NOT DONE, such as SUBJECT MORIBUND.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: CLREASND

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLLOC

datasetVariables.description: Can be used to specify where a clinical sign occurred. Example: LEFT EAR for skin rash.
datasetVariables.label: Location of a Finding
datasetVariables.name: CLLOC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Example: TOX TECHNICIAN, OPHTHALMOLOGIST, VETERINARIAN.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: CLEVAL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLSEV

datasetVariables.description: Describes the severity or intensity of a particular finding.
datasetVariables.label: Severity
datasetVariables.name: CLSEV

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLEXCLFL

datasetVariables.description: Y if the result should be excluded from all calculations, otherwise null.
datasetVariables.label: Exclusion Flag
datasetVariables.name: CLEXCLFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLREASEX

datasetVariables.description: The reason the result should be excluded from all calculations. Used only when CLEXCLFL is Y.
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion
datasetVariables.name: CLREASEX

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLUSCHFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicates whether the timing of a performed test or observation was unscheduled. If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
datasetVariables.name: CLUSCHFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of collection. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Collection
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the clinical observation in ISO 8601 format. For measurements related to a continuous evaluation interval, CLDTC should be used to indicate the start date/time of that interval.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Observation
datasetVariables.name: CLDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of end of observation interval, in ISO 8601 format. Should be populated when CLDTC represents the start date/time of a continuous evaluation interval.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Observation
datasetVariables.name: CLENDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of observation, in integer days. For measurements related to a continuous evaluation interval, CLDY can be used to indicate start day of that interval. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Observation
datasetVariables.name: CLDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of End of Observation

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Observation

datasetVariables.description: Study day of the end of observation, in integer days. Can be populated when CLDY represents the start day of a continuous evaluation interval. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of End of Observation
datasetVariables.name: CLENDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLNOMDY

datasetVariables.description: Nominal study day used for grouping records for observations that may occur on different days into a single reported study day. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
datasetVariables.name: CLNOMDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLNOMLBL

datasetVariables.description: A label for a given value of CLNOMDY as presented in the study report. Examples: "Week 4," "Day 28," "Terminal Sac".
datasetVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
datasetVariables.name: CLNOMLBL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when an observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time postdose.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: CLTPT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of CLTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: CLTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned Elapsed time (in ISO 8601 format) relative to a planned reference (CLTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "- PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by CLTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by CLTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: CLELTM

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by CLELTM, if used for CLTPTNUM, and CLTPT. It is recommended that CLTPTREF be as descriptive as possible, so the reference time point can be inferred without looking at other variables. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: CLTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CL.CLRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the reference time point, CLTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: CLRFTDTC

description: This domain captures clinical sign information including ophthalmology, physical examination, and dermal examination collected in life while executing the study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, SDOMAIN, C95086, 2018-06-29)
label: Clinical Observations
name: CL
